sentences: Saare on Eesti suuruselt teine saar.
Kuigi ta oli Saarest pärit, kolis ta Tallinna.
context: The word 'saare' is the genitive case of the Estonian noun 'saar', which means 'island'. In this genitive form (possessive case), it can mean 'of the island' or indicate origin/possession related to an island. It's commonly used when referring to someone coming from a specific island or when describing something that belongs to an island.
